name: stargazer

stargazer noun [C]
(LOOKING AT STARS)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a person who is involved in astronomy or astrology: Environmentalists and stargazers both want dark skies. Star gazers with small telescopes may be able to spot the comet on Monday night. Compare
astrologer
astronomer
More examplesFewer examplesStargazers around the world watched as a small black spot crossed from one side of the sun to the other.Summer skies can be frustrating to even the most casual stargazers.For thousands of years, stargazers have seen the aftermath of supernova explosions in the night sky.

stargazer noun [C]
(WATCHING FAMOUS PEOPLE)
someone who watches famous people in public places: Celebrities, stargazers, and movie executives all attend the Cannes film festival. An army of star-gazers followed the singer wherever he went.
